> 
> Exactly! ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
> No, seriously, I've been sort of busy lately, so I haven't really been around as much. I've still been looking in from time to time though.
> 
> That IVA looks really nice, Cholesterol. Do you mind if I integrate it into the main mod for version 0.4? (Whenever that is...)

OhpleaseOhpleaseOhplease.... do an update with that IVA, and adjustment from the heat/drag changes.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-03T01:16:18Z" title="07/03/2015 01:16  AM" data-short="9 yr">July 3, 2015</time> by Murdabenne**

> 
> Just update IVA to v0.9 on [Curse](http://kerbal.curseforge.com/ksp-mods/231535-ixs-enterprise-iva)

My game glitches out when I load the command pod with this in-game. The screen goes dark, and all the planets have disappeared.
Is this mod confirmed to work with interstellar on 1.0.4?

> 
> Is this mod confirmed to work with interstellar on 1.0.4?

has this been updated at all yet?
Nothing has been confirmed to work with 1.0.4 as I haven't gotten around to updating it yet. Sorry.

> 
> Nothing has been confirmed to work with 1.0.4 as I haven't gotten around to updating it yet. Sorry.

Once Sophia confirms it, I'll update CKAN.

> 
> Is this mod confirmed to work with interstellar on 1.0.4?

KSPIE likely will be very hard for this to work with - it has become a pretty complex and broad mod.
Gonna keep an eye on this for my end game modded play through. Looks fun!
Can't seem to find the AWD in the files, nor in the game, and it says that it is part of the mod?

Fir some reason, when I try activating the warp drives, a blue bubble appears around the craft, then suddenly, Boom. Everything goes flying out into space. What am I doing Wrong?!

EDIT:Yup, that's fixed. But now the warp drive complains that it has "No Power" when trying to go above warp setting 1.5, I even made my own part so it has 240000000000 ElectricCharge, and that's NOT exaggerated. WHY THE HECK IS THIS HAPPENING?!?!?!?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-25T15:09:16Z" title="07/25/2015 03:09  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 25, 2015</time> by greenbow66**

This is an amazing creation, but I admit I prefer USI's 'cubi drive effect more, but I love the part block designs. Would it be safe to use these in conjunction with USI's warp drive, or would I want to use them separately..?

e: have discovered they not only work together nicely but I can build some GLORIOUS new stuff \*\_\* thank you so much for taking this up, Sophia!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-05T03:25:26Z" title="08/05/2015 03:25  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 5, 2015</time> by Kershu5**
So, is it safe for 1.04?
Just going to express my interest in the continuation of this mod, it's a lovely piece of work!

Hey, 

first i want to express how awesome this mod is!

I have come across a problem, how do you keep a docked lander on the ship when engaging the warp drive?

Even when using the included docking rings the lander just blows up! Am i doing smething wrong or is this intended?

How about tweakscale integration for the warp ring and support ring?

(I think it would allow much more diverse constructions)

Are warp nacelles possible as a alternative to the ring?

As I'm not using KSPI:E, I may be missing something important- how the heck do I *generate* warp plasma? I'm just using this along with USI's stuff. I like the idea of the plasma generators but unless I bring positively HORRENDOUS amounts of plasma with me it's not really worth it..

e: also, how the deuce to get the develocitizer to work, keeps saying it has no power..?

ee: figured most of it out, just gotta work out why the warp ring is giving me trouble now. Almost there!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-31T20:39:56Z" title="08/31/2015 08:39  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 31, 2015</time> by Kershu5**
any plans to update this for 1.0.4?

I have *plans*, yes... but I'm afraid not much has come of them so far, so I'm not going to set an ETA or get anyone's hopes up.

I am still sort of around, though!

If you don't mind me suggesting an idea, Sophia- any possibility of tweaking the painful sensitivity of the Warp Bubble is? If I don't use extremely specific designs then it makes my whole ship explode into a series of lovely pieces and debris. Or is that Working As Intended?

The original mod had support for Extraplanetary Launchpads. Does this standalone version not have that? I tried using the spacedocks, but they don't appear to do anything at all except hold rocketparts.

Ran into a problem.

I can't add more than two fuel pods or anything else to the Main Hull part. The first two just click on, but if I try putting other fuel pods or science labs I can't get it to snap on.

Help

Works beautifully in 1.0.5. I recompiled it for my game, and updated the devlocitizer so that if you don't have enough power to cancel all of your velocity, you can cancel some of it and make up the difference with engines. [Grab it here if you like](https://github.com/Angel-125/warpship). ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") Now I just need to add something to convert ExoticMatter into WarpPlasma for my game (easy enough to do..), and I'm good to go. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Anyway, here is a refit of my Pegasus ship with warp technology:

![kdRcKs3.png](http://i.imgur.com/kdRcKs3.png)

> 
>

> 
> 
> Works beautifully in 1.0.5. I recompiled it for my game, and updated the devlocitizer so that if you don't have enough power to cancel all of your velocity, you can cancel some of it and make up the difference with engines. Thank you very much, buit can you please share a compiled version?

> 
> 
> 17 hours ago, Nansuchao said:
> 
> 
> Thank you very much, buit can you please share a compiled version?
> 

Sure, I'll create a release when I get home from work tonight. I really like Sophia's take on the warship, it is fun to use. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Thanks a lot. 

Yes, the works of Sophia made this mod better also than the initial release of Stevie, that was revolutionary.

On a side note, congratulations for your others mods. You're one of the best contributors of this community.
